radiographic_examinations.findings: Paramediastinal linear opacities in the upper lobes, with architectural distortion, features consistent with radiation fibrosis, and bilateral small pleural effusions.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Present since she was 30 years of age.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Paramediastinal architectural distortion of the bilateral upper lobes and bronchiectasis, features consistent with radiation fibrosis, calcification of the left anterior descending and left circumflex coronary arteries suggestive of atherosclerosis, slight dilatation of the left atrium, and a small posterior left-sided pleural effusion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increasing thickening of aortic-valve and mitral-valve leaflets over years.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Lack of primary peristaltic waves indicative of a motility disorder and spontaneous reflux of barium up to the clavicles.
Clustered pleomorphic microcalcifications in the upper outer quadrant of the right breast suggestive of ductal carcinoma in situ.
Clumped nodular enhancement in the upper outer quadrant of the right breast that corresponds to the microcalcifications seen on the mammogram, suggestive of ductal carcinoma in situ.
Progressive thickening of aortic-valve and mitral-valve leaflets, resulting in mild-to-moderate aortic stenosis, moderate aortic regurgitation, and moderate mitral regurgitation.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive changes noted over the years.

radiographic_examinations.findings: 85% stenosis of the proximal right coronary artery and 70% stenosis in the middle third of the proximal right coronary artery.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial detection 2 years earlier during previous cardiac catheterization.
